Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of chariot scene to right (at far left, part of round shield with added red rim; of horses, necks, heads, and parts of tails missing; red on tails); behind the horses, lower body of draped figure (red on chiton); below, dilute band above glazed zone.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Boston II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA, Fasc. 19, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (p. 5, pl. 108, no. 12)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 127, pl. XXXIX, no. 354.4)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 235, no. 207)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0969)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4780 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
